alert.note: Alert for Mesa; Montrose (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 5:51PM MDT until May 09 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of the Dolores River from the confluence with the San Miguel River in western Colorado to the confluence with the Colorado River in eastern Utah, including the town of Gateway, CO. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying along the Dolores River is imminent or occurring. Several low-lying river crosses and river side campgrounds may become inaccessible or inundated with water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 551 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated snowmelt. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Colorado River, Salt Creek, Roc Creek, Granite Creek, Mesa Creek, West Creek, Maverick Canyon, North Fork Mesa Creek, John Brown Creek, Dolores River, Blue Creek, Little Maverick Canyon, Waring Canyon and Fisher Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gateway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to rising rivers, streams, or creeks as river levels often peak overnight. Please heed local advisories and closures.
